member.name: T:MapImporter.Data
member.summary: Stores the data for each layer. Each layer contains a list of gids and those are stored as a matrix.

member.name: M:MapImporter.Data.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantiates the new multidimensional array.
member.param: The number of tiles in the i direction.
The number of tiles in the j direction.

member.name: M:MapImporter.Data.GetTileData(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the gid of the tile at the specified indices.
member.param: The index in the i direction.
The index in the j direction.
member.returns: The global id at the given indices.

member.name: M:MapImporter.Data.SetTileDataAt(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the global id of the given indices to the new value. Here if you need it, but don't try rewriting your whole map using it.
member.param: The new global id to be stored at this position.
The index in the i direction.
The index in the j direction.

member.name: M:MapImporter.Data.PrintData
member.summary: Prints the entire matrix to the console. Used for debugging.

member.name: P:MapImporter.Data.TileData
member.summary: Holds the global ids for each tile in the layer.

member.name: T:MapImporter.Image
member.summary: An image object that can be used like a tileset.

member.name: P:MapImporter.Image.Format
member.summary: Used for embedded images, in combination with a data child element. Valid values are file extensions like png, gif, jpg, bmp, etc. (since 0.9.0)

member.name: P:MapImporter.Image.Source
member.summary: The reference to the tileset image file (Tiled supports most common image formats).

member.name: P:MapImporter.Image.Trans
member.summary: Defines a specific color that is treated as transparent (example value: "#FF00FF" for magenta). Up until Tiled 0.10, this value is written out without a # but this is planned to change.

member.name: P:MapImporter.Image.Width
member.summary: The image width in pixels (optional, used for tile index correction when the image changes).

member.name: P:MapImporter.Image.Height
member.summary: The image height in pixels (optional).

member.name: P:MapImporter.Image.Texture
member.summary: Specifically for use by the Xna/MonoGame Framework. The image must be loaded from the Source path using the content pipeline.

members.member:
Loads the Texture objects required for each Tileset.
This method can be a common cause of NullReferenceExceptions. If the Tileset textures are not properly loaded, the Map object cannot be drawn. If the files cannot be located in the project, there will be a Null Reference.
If your project stores all Tileset textures inside a "tilesets" folder in your Content directory, you could alter the filepath to automatically look in that folder.
To call this method:
public void LoadTilesetTextures(ContentManager content);
A ContentManager object is needed in order to load the textures.

member.summary: Defines the possible types that an Object can be. Objects have the same properties and ObjectType allows the program determine how to treat them.

member.summary: The Object is a Rectangle.

member.name: F:MapImporter.ObjectType.Polygon
member.summary: The Object is a Polygon.

member.name: F:MapImporter.ObjectType.Ellipse
member.summary: The Object is an Ellipse.

member.name: F:MapImporter.ObjectType.Polyline
member.summary: The Object is a Polyline.

member.name: F:MapImporter.ObjectType.Image
member.summary: The Object is an Image.

member.name: T:MapImporter.Object
member.summary: While tile layers are very suitable for anything repetitive aligned to the tile grid, sometimes you want to annotate your map with other information, not necessarily aligned to the grid. Hence the objects have their coordinates and size in pixels, but you can still easily align that to the grid when you want to. You generally use objects to add custom information to your tile map, such as spawn points, warps, exits, etc. When the object has a gid set, then it is represented by the image of the tile with that global ID. Currently that means width and height are ignored for such objects. The image alignment currently depends on the map orientation. In orthogonal orientation it's aligned to the bottom-left while in isometric it's aligned to the bottom-center. If IsEllipse is true, then the object is an Ellipse. If Polygon is not null, the object is a Polygon. If Polyline is not null, then the object is a Polyline. If Image is not null, the object is an Image. If all of these are null, then the object is a Rectangle.

member.name: T:MapImporter.Polygon
member.summary: Each polygon object is made up of a space-delimited list of x,y coordinates. The origin for these coordinates is the location of the parent object. By default, the first point is created as 0,0 denoting that the point will originate exactly where the object is placed.

The second Tile object to compare.

member.param: The first Tile object to compare.

member.summary: Overrided ToString method for Tile objects.

member.name: P:MapImporter.Tile.Id
member.summary: The local tile id that identifys this Tile inside of its own tileset. While this property is accessible, it would be inefficient to reference an individual Tile by its local id.

member.name: P:MapImporter.Tile.Gid
member.summary: The global tile id of this Tile object. Every Tile has a unique id property to identify it across all tilesets.

member.name: P:MapImporter.Tile.Terrain
member.summary: Defines the terrain type of each corner of the tile, given as comma-separated indexes in the terrain types array in the order top-left, top-right, bottom-left, bottom-right. Leaving out a value means that corner has no terrain. (optional) (since 0.9.0)

member.name: P:MapImporter.Tile.Probability
member.summary: A percentage indicating the probability that this tile is chosen when it competes with others while editing with the terrain tool. (optional) (since 0.9.0)

member.name: P:MapImporter.Tile.Props
member.summary: Custom properties for the tile object.

member.name: P:MapImporter.Tile.Location
member.summary: The location of this individual tile in the tileset.

member.name: P:MapImporter.Tile.ObjectGroup
member.summary: Object group this tile is part of (optional).

member.name: T:MapImporter.TileOffset
member.summary: This element is used to specify an offset in pixels, to be applied when drawing a tile from the related tileset. When not present, no offset is applied.

member.summary: Constructor for the TileOffset class.

member.name: M:MapImporter.TileOffset.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor for the TileOffset class.
member.param: The horizontal offset in pixels.
The vertical offset in pixels.

member.name: P:MapImporter.TileOffset.X
member.summary: The horizontal offset in pixels.

member.name: P:MapImporter.TileOffset.Y
member.summary: The vertical offset in pixels (positive is down).

member.summary: Constructor for the Tileset class.

member.summary: Constructor for the Tileset class.
member.param: The first global tile id of this tileset.
The name of the tileset.
The (maximum) width of the tiles in this tileset.
The (maximum) height of the tiles in this tileset.
The spacing in pixels between the tiles in this tileset.
The margin around the tiles in this tileset.

member.name: M:MapImporter.Tileset.GetTileByLocalId(System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds and returns the Tile with the given local id (its Id within its Tileset; chances are you will never need this).
member.param: The local id of the tile to search for.
member.returns: The tile with the given local id.

member.name: M:MapImporter.Tileset.GetTile(System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds and returns the Tile in this Tileset with the given global id.
member.param: The global id of the tile to search for.
member.returns: The tile with the given global id.

member.name: M:MapImporter.Tileset.GetTile(System.String)
member.summary: Finds and returns all Tiles with the given property name.
member.param: The name of the property to search for.
member.returns: The tiles with the given property contained in a List.

member.name: M:MapImporter.Tileset.Contains(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the Tile with the given global id is part of this Tileset object.
member.param: The global id of the Tile to find.
member.returns: Whether or not the Tile object is conatined in this Tileset.

member.param: The first Tileset object to compare.
The second Tileset object to compare.
member.returns: Whether the first Tileset has a lower first global id than the second Tileset.

member.param: The first Tileset object to compare.
The second Tileset object to compare.
member.returns: Whether the first Tileset has a larger first global id than the second Tileset.

member.summary: The first global id property for Tilesets is used to compare Tilesets for greater than and less than operations.
member.param: The first Tileset object to compare.
The second Tileset object to compare.
member.returns: Whether the first Tileset has a higher first global id than the second Tileset or whether they are equal.
